revised_title: Cholinergic Desensitization Kinetics in Aplysia Neurons
tldr: The authors studied the kinetic properties of cholinergic desensitization in Aplysia neurons using voltage-clamped techniques. They found that desensitization of the acetylcholine-induced current in response to microperfused acetylcholine occurred in two phases and was best modeled as the sum of two exponential components plus a constant. The results demonstrate that the onset of desensitization of this ACh response involves at least two processes that are dose- and temperature-sensitive, showing a fundamental difference between Aplysia neurons and the vertebrate neuromuscular junction.
